title: Configure LLM and Real-Time Models for Voice AI Agents in iMash
lede: This guide explains the difference between real-time and LLM models in iMash, how they handle speech and text, and how to configure the correct settings for your Voice AI Agent.

steps.title: Choose a Model Type
steps.content:
When creating or editing an agent, you can select from two model types:

  • Real-Time Models: Handle audio input and output directly (speech-to-speech). No additional configuration is required.
  • LLM Models: Process text input and output (speech-to-text-to-speech). These require an additional Transcriber tab to manage speech recognition and set the voice output through the voice configuration.

steps.title: Configure LLM Settings
steps.content:
1. If you choose an LLM Model, a new Transcriber tab will appear.
  2. In the Transcriber tab, configure:
    • Input Language: Select the language the model should recognise for transcription.
    • Specialised Model Options: Choose models optimised for specific vocabularies or domains.
  3. The agent flow will be: Speech â†’ Text â†’ LLM Response â†’ Voice Output.

steps.title: Use Real-Time Models
steps.content:
1. If you select a Real-Time Model, transcription and voice synthesis are handled automatically by the model.
  2. The conversation flows directly from speech input to speech output, with no additional configuration tabs, but you can always choose a different voice for the model.

steps.title: Experiment with Settings
steps.content: Test different model and transcriber configurations to determine which works best for your use case. Adjust the recognised language or choose specialised models for higher accuracy with industry-specific terms.
